gurmukhi: iCn mY fwirE mwr sRaunq ibMd dwnv mhwN ]172]
transliteration: Chhin Mai Daario Maar Sraounat Biaad Daanav Mahaan||172||
translation: In this way, both of them together , have killed the chief demon Raktavija in an instant.172.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI mwrkMfy purwny sRI cMfI cirqR aukiq iblws rkq bIj bDih nwm pMcmo iDAwie ]5]
transliteration: It(i) Sroo Maarkande Puraane Sroo Channdoo Charitra Oukat(i) Bilaas Rakat Booj Badhah(i) Naam Panchmo Dhiaae||5||
translation: End of the fifth Chapter entitled ‘Killing of Raktavija’ in SRI CHANDI CHARITRA UKATI BILAS of Markandeya Purana.5.

gurmukhi: qu`C bcy Bj kY rn iqAwg kY suMB insuMB pY jwie pukwry ]
transliteration: Touchchh Bache Bhaj Kai Ran Tiaag Kai Sounbh Nisounbh Pai Jaae Poukdare||
translation: A small number of demons were saved by running away; they went to Sumbh and Nisumbh and requested him:

gurmukhi: sRaunq bIj hinE duh ny imil Aaur mhwN Bt mwr ibdwry ]
transliteration: Sraounat Booj Hanio Duh Ne Mil(i) Aur Mahaan Bhat Maar Biddare||
translation: “Both of them together have killed Raktavija and also have killed and destroyed many others.”

gurmukhi: ieau suin kY aun ky muK qy qb boil auiTE kir K`g sMBwry ]
transliteration: Io Soun(i) Kai Oun Ke Moukh Te Tab Bol(i) Outhio Kar(i) Khagg Sanbhdare||
translation: Hearing these words form their mouth, the king Sumbh spoke thus;

gurmukhi: ieau hinhoN br cMif pRcMif Ajw bn mY ijm isMG pCwry ]173]
transliteration: Io Hanihon Bar Channd(i) Prachanndd(i0 Ajaa Ban Mai Jim Singh Pachhdare||173||
translation: “I shall kill the fierce Chandi thus going in front of her just as the lion knocks down a goat in the forest.173.

gurmukhi: skl ktk ky Btn ko dieE ju`D ko swj ]
transliteration: Sakal Katak Ke Bhatan Ko Daio Juddh Ko Saaj||
translation: He gave the material of war to all the warriors.

gurmukhi: ssqR phr kY ieau kihE hinhoN cMfih Awju ]174]
transliteration: Sastra Pahar Kai Io Kahio Hanihon Channdah(i) Aaj(u)||174||
translation: He himself wore his arms and armour and said this:” I shall kill Chandi to-day.”174.

gurmukhi: kop kY suMB insuMB cFy Duin duMdB kI dshUM ids DweI ]
transliteration: Kop Kai Sounbh Nisounbh Chadhe Dhoun(i) Doundabh Koo Das-hoon Dis Dhaaoo||
translation: In great rage, both Sumbh and Nisumbh marched forward for war; the trumpets sounded in all the ten directions.

gurmukhi: pwiek AgR Bey miD bwj rQI rQ swj kY pwNiq bnweI ]
transliteration: Paaik Agra Bhae Madh(i) Baaj Rathoo Rath Saaj Kai Paant(i) Banaaoo||
translation: In front there were warriors on foot, in the middle the warriors on horses and behind them, the charioteers have arranged the chariots in rows.

gurmukhi: mwqy mqMg ky puMjn aUpir suMdr quMg Dujw PhrweI ]
transliteration: Maate Matan Ke Pounjan Oopar(i) Soundar Tuaag Dhujaa Phahraaoo||
translation: On the palanquins of the intoxicated elephants, beautiful and lofty banners are flying.
